section.p: There is no doubt that we have to live with far more noise than in the past, particularly in cities, and this may be the form of pollution which affects us most directly. For example, it has been found that prolonged exposure to high levels of noise can lead to""be caused by""be due to"" hearing loss and high blood pressure. It may also give rise to""be due to""be caused by"" stress, insomnia and mental problems, including depression. These problems, in turn, often result in""result from""stem from"" lower productivity at work because""due to""on account of"" employees are too tired and stressed to work efficiently.

In order to find effective solutions to the problem, it is necessary to understand what has brought about""resulted from""stemmed from"" this increase in noise. There are three main causes. Firstly, there is traffic noise, due to""because""resulting in"" the ever-increasing number of vehicles on our roads. The second major source of noise in our cities is low-flying aircraft which have either just taken off, or are just landing at local airports. Finally, there is noise caused by""leading to""giving rise to"" neighbours listening to music or watching television at full volume, or using noisy power tools such as drills or lawn mowers.

Clearly, noise is a serious problem. It is therefore essential that""The most obvious answer for""One way in which"" measures should be taken to reduce the amount of noise in our daily lives. Regarding traffic noise, the most obvious answer is""it is essential that""one way in which"" improved soundproofing for buildings near busy roads. In addition, local authorities ought to consider""must""should"" imposing strict speed limits in residential areas.

One way in which""One solution for""The most obvious answer for"" aircraft noise could be lessened is by building airports further away from urban areas. Moreover, legislation should""might""may"" prohibit aeroplanes from flying over built-up areas. As far as noisy neighbours are concerned, the only effective solution is""one way in which""it is essential that"" for us all to behave more considerately by, for example, turning down the volume of our music or televisions and limiting our use of noisy power tools.

In conclusion, there is no simple solution to the problem. However, if the measures I have suggested were introduced, we would all enjoy a better quality of life. As a result of""Because""Consequently"" living and working in a quieter environment, people would feel more relaxed and they would be less prone to the physiological and psychological problems that are known to stem from""lead to""bring about"" exposure to high levels of noise.

p.font: In order to analyse the reasons why a problem exists and suggest solutions, you will need to describe ‘cause and effect’ relationships. There are certain phrases, which are useful for this.
